Job Title: Office Administrator

Location: Pelham, GA

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Accounting/Auditing, Administrative, Customer Service

Description:
Fire-Dex is a family-owned company headquartered in Ohio with a primary manufacturing facility located in Pelham, Georgia. Our four operations facilities specialize in creating head-to-toe firefighter protective gear for first responders worldwide. Our Gear Wash subsidiary is the world’s largest Independent Service Provider (ISP) for gear care and maintenance, we ensure that firefighters’ equipment remains in top condition. Our offerings include turnout gear, alternative PPE, boots, hoods, gloves, and helmets. We are looking to add to our team of dynamic associates in Pelham with associates who are ready to contribute to our mission to serve those who serveWe are seeking an organized and detail-oriented Office Administrator to join our team. In this role, you will handle various administrative tasks and support our production operations. If you thrive in a fast-paced environment and have excellent communication skills, we’d love to hear from you!Work Hours:Monday through Thursday: 7:00 am - 4:30 pmFriday: 7:00 am – 11:00 am – start your weekend earlierLocation: 620 W Railroad ST S, Pelham, GA 31779
Responsibilities Include: Answer and direct incoming phone calls to the appropriate associates Greet visitors in a professional mannerProcess, sort, and route incoming and outgoing mailOversees security fob system Maintain organized filing systems.Handle accounts payable tasks.Prepare shipping and receiving documentation.Generate labels using multiple software programs.Adapt to new computer programs as needed.Place orders and manage inventory.Maintain confidentiality of all financial dataTrack shop order status throughout production.Create and manage spreadsheets.Type documents and correspondence efficiently.Answer multi-line phones professionally.Welcome and assist visitors to the office.Record and promptly distribute messages.Document attendance call-ins from associates.Other duties as assigned. Candidates should possess the following:Previous experience in office administration, including accounting-related responsibilities.Proficiency in Microsoft Office applications (Word, Excel, and Outlook).Strong verbal and written communication skills.Excellent organizational abilities, with the capacity to manage multiple priorities and meet deadlines.Problem-solving skills and a sense of urgency.High school diploma or equivalent.Basic math skills.Ability to work collaboratively in a team-oriented environment.Benefits Include:Competitive SalaryHealth, dental and vision insurance for you and your familyPaid time off, including parental leave401(k) with matching, life insurance, EAP for entire family, discount programs and other perksProfit sharing bonuses based upon company successWork in state-of-the-art facilities which create customized head-to-toe protection for first respondersFulfillment about the purposeful work you do within an impactful industryMore About Us:Our values include fun, integrity, respect, and excellence = FIRE!Our dedicated team of associates have helped pave the path of innovation for new products and services that are focused on the health and safety of first responders41 years in businessMulti award-winning organization – including multiple repeat recognition as a Top Workplace by NorthCoast 99 eight times over, Family Business Achievement Awards, Smart Culture Awards, Cascade Business Growth Awards and Weatherhead 100!
Be part of making the highest quality personal protective equipment in the USA and keeping first responders safe!Learn more about our culture and team!Find purposeful work within an impactful industry: https://youtu.be/Z8Pgfsj6wVcFind your work passion with the Fire-Dex family: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=zh-cq2r1xyUHow It's Made: Turnout Gear: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=KwgnI2OjBXk
Equal Opportunity Employer (EOE) 
Hourly range: $16-18 hour

Experience Level (if available): Associate
